meanings.definition: A sensation of whirling and loss of balance, associated particularly with looking down from a great height or caused by disease affecting the inner ear.
meanings.sent1: The vertigoes made her feel like the room was spinning around her.
meanings.sent2: He experienced vertigoes when he peered over the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The vertigoes from the carnival ride left her feeling dizzy but exhilarated.
meanings.sent4: The vertigoes of love swept him off his feet in a whirlwind of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The vertigoes of the roller coaster ride were both terrifying and thrilling.

meanings.definition: A giddy sensation of tilting within stable surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The sudden vertigoes made him feel like the ground was shifting beneath him.
meanings.sent2: She felt vertigoes as if the room was spinning around her, even though she was standing still.
meanings.sent3: The vertigoes of the boat rocking gently on the water made her giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His vertigoes of happiness were evident in the way he danced around the room.
meanings.sent5: The vertigoes of excitement bubbled up inside her like fizzy soda.
